newsitem.title: USA: Conceptus in Japanese marketing agreement.
newsitem.headline: Conceptus in Japanese marketing agreement.

text.p: Conceptus Inc said on Thursday it has entered a deal granting JMS Co exclusive rights to market its infertility diagnostic products in Japan.

The agreement covers the company's full line of diagnostic products, including the Transcervical Tubal Access Catheter (T-TAC) System and the Selective Tubal Assessment to Refine Reproductive Therapy (STARRT) Falloposcopy System.

In addition to marketing Conceptus' products, JMS will manage the process for obtaining regulatory approval and procedural reimbursement in Japan. Additional terms of the agreement were not disclosed.

The T-TAC is a system of microcatheters and guidewires which enable physicians to access and navigate the fallopian tube in a non-surgical approach. T-TAC facilitates a more direct, accurate and rapid diagnosis of tubal disorders than conventional diagnostic methods and may result in reduced rates of invasive infertility interventions such as in-vitro fertilization with embryo transfer and tubal surgery, the company said.

The STARRT System is designed to allow physicians to perform a new medical procedure involving the insertion of a micro-endoscope into the fallopian tube to diagnosis tubal occlusion, a cause of infertility.
"We feel that this agreement with JMS represents a tremendous opportunity both now and for the future," said Kathryn Tunstall, president and chief executive of Conceptus.
"Because of the exceedingly low birthrate in Japan, the government proactively supports infertility treatment."
